content.description: The following question refers to the topic of conservatism in the nineteenth century.
content.question: The Congress system of diplomacy in the early nineteenth century differed most strongly from the diplomatic arrangements in Europe during the period between the peace of Westphalia and the French Revolution in that members of the Congress system

choices.label: were explicitly committed to intervening in other states to preserve existing regimes
were dedicated to spreading a single form of Christianity throughout Europe
were largely in favor of dismantling tariffs and other trade barriers between European states
sought to prevent any one state from becoming overly powerful

content.answer: were explicitly committed to intervening in other states to preserve existing regimes

topic.text: 6.5: The Concert of Europe and European Conservatism

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
